metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: When a variable is created in C, a memory address is assigned to the variable.
content.html: When a variable is created in C, a memory address is assigned to the variable.

content.text: The memory address is the location of where the variable is stored on the computer.
content.html: The memory address is the location of where the variable is stored on the computer.

content.text: When we assign a value to the variable, it is stored in this memory address.
content.html: When we assign a value to the variable, it is stored in this memory address.

content.text: To access it, use the reference operator ( & ), and the result represents where the variable is stored:
content.html: To access it, use the reference operator (&), and the result represents where the variable is stored:

content.code_html:
int myAge = 43;
printf("%p", &myAge); // Outputs 0x7ffe5367e044

content.text: Note: The memory address is in hexadecimal form (0x..). You will probably not get the same result in your program, as this depends on where the variable is stored on your computer.
content.html: Note: The memory address is in hexadecimal form (0x..). You will probably not get the same result in your program, as this depends on where the variable is stored on your computer.

content.text: You should also note that &myAge is often called a "pointer". A pointer basically stores the memory address of a variable as its value. To print pointer values, we use the %p format specifier.
content.html: You should also note that &myAge is often called a "pointer". A pointer basically stores the memory address of a variable as its value. To print pointer values, we use the %p format specifier.

content.text: You will learn much more about pointers in the next chapter.
content.html: You will learn much more about pointers in the next chapter.

content.text: Why is it useful to know the memory address?
Pointers are important in C, because they allow us to manipulate the data in the computer's memory - this can reduce the code and improve the performance .
content.html: Pointers are important in C, because they allow us to manipulate the data in the computer's memory - this can reduce the code and improve the performance.

content.text: Pointers are one of the things that make C stand out from other programming languages, like Python and Java .
content.html: Pointers are one of the things that make C stand out from other programming languages, like Python and Java.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What does the memory address represent in C?
content.html: What does the memory address represent in C?
